risks_and_complications: Damage to adjacent teeth or tooth restorations.
Chipping, breaking or loosening of the veneer.
Injury to soft tissues adjacent to veneer due to bonding or bleaching agents.
Necessity for a more extensive restoration, such as a crown, than originally diagnosed.
Inability to exactly match tooth coloration.
Changes in the shade, aesthetics, and appearance of the restoration, which may occur over time.
Swelling, jaw muscle tenderness or even resultant numbness of the tongue, lips, teeth, jaws and/or facial tissues.
Changes to the bite or position of the temporomandibular joint which may require further treatment or adjustment.
alternatives_to_treatment: Alternative methods of treatment have been explained to me, such as: ________________________
